DataElement.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Liver Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable response regarding whether the patient meets the criteria to participate in a specific clinical trial based on the person's medical history of liver disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Liver Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium.  It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Liver Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium.  It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have clinically
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically important history of liver disease, including viral or other hepatitis or cirrhosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known, clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history of hepatitis C (HCV), do they have an undetectable viral load and any treatment received for HCV has been completed at least three weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active hepatic or biliary disease (with exception of patients with Gilbert's syndrome, asymptomatic gallstones, liver metastases or stable chronic liver disease per investigator assessment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease (have previously tested positive), including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any chronic or concurrent acute liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, has patient been treated and HCV viral load is undetectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis, cirrhosis, fatty liver, and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a history of hepatitis C, Have they completed and been off of hepatitis C treatment for at least 1 month prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have liver disease such as cirrhosis, decompensated liver disease, and active and chronic hepatitis (i.e., quantifiable HBV-DNA and/or positive HbsAg, quantifiable HCV-RNA)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have liver infiltration or hemolysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known history of Hepatitis B(defined as Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsA) reactive or known hepatitis C virus (HCV RNA qualitative) infection?
